thread.title: Podcast: Takeaways from KU basketball media day
thread.title_full: Podcast: Takeaways from KU basketball media day

author: The Capital-Journal
title: Podcast: Takeaways from KU basketball media day
text:
By The Capital-Journal 
LAWRENCE — KU basketball forward Cheick Diallo will be at Late Night in the Phog next Friday, but will he be in the Jayhawks' lineup when their season begins? 
Diallo, a freshman forward, and coach Bill Self both addressed the pending ruling on Diallo's eligibility during the team's media day Thursday at Allen Fieldhouse. 
“Can't really give a decision if you don't have the information in front of you,” Self said. “We hope (a decision) is sooner rather than later. I've said that all along. But I don't know that there's any indication that there will be an exact timeline other than the fact I'm sure it will be done before the season starts.” 
If Diallo is indeed cleared by the NCAA, how will that affect the Jayhawks' rotation, which Self said will likely not be 10 deep? The Topeka Capital-Journal's Jesse Newell, Matt Galloway and Kevin Haskin discuss this on the latest edition of the KU HawkZone Podcast. Also discussed: Wayne Selden's playing time, the expected roles of freshmen Carlton Bragg and Lagerald Vick, and the KU football team's uncertainty at quarterback. 
Mobile viewers can listen to the podcast here or via the HawkZone app. And be sure to subscribe on iTunes, Stitcher or SoundCloud for new episodes as they are posted.
